title: Amazing Treatment
body: I can’t speak highly enough of the headland Unit, everything they do demonstrates their care towards their patients. Thankyou doesn’t cover the effort the professionalism and the care they show to the patients they care for each day. Such professionals and caring people thank you so much for your caring skills.

title: Wonderful experience
body:
From start to finish the treatment here was first class.  I was very nervous when arriving but my fears were soon put to rest after being reassured by the friendly and approachable nursing staff.  The operating theatre and indeed the whole of SpaMedica was ultra clean and state of the art.  After the anaesthetic eye drops were administered, I had to wait a while to go into theatre, and during the procedure there was absolutely no pain at all and it was over in less than 10 munutes.  

I would advise anyone who is nervous about this procedure, to just get it done - you won’t feel a thing and the benefits to your sight after are just unbelievable.

title: Wonderful experience
body:
From start to finish the treatment here was first class.  I was very nervous when arriving but my fears were soon put to rest after being reassured by the friendly and approachable nursing staff.  The operating theatre and indeed the whole of SpaMedica was ultra clean and state of the art.  After the anaesthetic eye drops were administered, I had to wait a while to go into theatre, and during the procedure there was absolutely no pain at all and it was over in less than 10 munutes.  

I would advise anyone who is nervous about this procedure, to just get it done - you won’t feel a thing and the benefits to your sight after are just unbelievable.

title: Exceptional Service
body: I have to give credit where it is due. I sent an email to the surgery via their website and was expecting to hear a response in a few days. I had a call from the reception staff within an hour who then arranged for a doctor to ring me back on the same time. The doctor that I spoke to was very helpful and gave me some good advice.  I know we are all quick to judge and complain about our gp services in recent times and things aren't as we would like them but I can't fault the service that I have received today. Thank you very much for your help today. Outstanding service.

title: I can't access the service
body:
I rang for an appointment on the 1st of December to be offered the next available appointment of the 21st of December, which is bad enough but not the issue, here. I naively asked what time it would be, to be told that the surgery don't give times; it's either morning or afternoon. I work at a school and for safeguarding reasons, cannot have my phone with me and I certainly can't just pick up the phone whenever it rings and take a call in the classroom. This surgery is stopping me and others, I expect, from accessing the gp service.
(I previously posted this in December and have waited to view it on this website but it hasn't appeared so I'm posting again. Can I have an email, to let me know why, if it's not being posted again, please.)

title: Really poor
body: needed a review on how i am on my prescription so had too wait 2 weeks for an appointment. My phone appointment was at 9am and no one had called me. After a very busy day, I called to ask why no one had called. Apparently, someone did call however i never recieved it. As I need to get back on the prescription asap, i asked if there was any chance i could be squeezed in today or any other prescription i could use in the mean time. That couldn’t happen and now I am booked in once again next week. I am going to be off my medication for now 3/4 weeks, which is really really poor. I am extremely disappointed

title: Useless doctors
body:
Receptionists are helpful but the Doctors cannot afford a 5 minute phone call with a patient that has been registered with At Razi for over a decade. Absolutely ridiculous, seeing as I have tested positive for Covid, recovering from pharyngitis and now also feel a throat infection coming on, all I needed was a 5 minute chat with a GP. 
And I say this as someone that regularly stays behind at my practice (pvt dental care) for non-urgent cases, so when I say there’s a lack of genuine concern for patients well-being it’s not unfounded.

title: City Road Medical Centre
body: I have been signed up to the Practice for two years. The staff are very friendly, welcoming and proffesional. It is a proactive practice reminding patients when 'flu immunisation injections are due and information about Covid potection procedures. Martin Tibbetts. Edgbaston

title: Fobbed off by reception
body: Rang to get results ask receptionist to send them by email told they don't do that pointed out I've had them in the past then change direction and said there was no one available in the office to send them. Had to go and collect them myself on arrival people stood around who could quite easily email me the results not helpful as usual

title: Received complex care
body: Whenever I go to the doctor there I feel taken care of. Even in covid times I've got good listener at the other end of the phone, I've got advice, new prescription and referrals, and in-person follow up with examination when the results arrived. It's been 5 year since I joined them and I decided to stay when moving a bit further.

title: Good practice
body: Practice did not have full quantity of prescribed medication on day of treatment. Was delivered, as promised, the following day. Thankfully, with the home delivery service I was able to avoid a return visit to the hospital to collect my medication.

title: Very good practice.
body: I have found everyone I have had dealings with most helpful and informative. Feel very in confident in all the staff.

title: Rubbish service
body: I’m writing on behalf of my wife . She has really bad pain and the long story short they did check but they don’t follow us at all . Even they promise to call today at 4:30 14/01/2022 . Never call and when we try to call the phone goes busy for like 2 hours before closing time until they close . How can I still respect this place . They really give bad name for NHS .

title: Shining Example
body:
I was booked in for a cataract removal and made an appointment at
Fakenham Medical Centre. Reception and medical staff were professional and very efficient. My appointment was for 1:15 and I was back home just after 2:00. A little uncomfortable but otherwise I have high praise for FMC, first class service. Thank you.

title: Good response to a phone call
body:
Rang early today (8am) to make a phone appt. 
I had a response very  soon afterwards  from a very friendly and finally very helpful doctor  once the situation was understood. 
Could not fault the service 
,

title: Terrible management
body: The management don't give their staff the recognition they deserve.  So full just trying to keep standards. Absolutely a distress to the mental health  service.

title: Very unsympatic
body: I went to AE with my 7years old son. He couldn't walk. I had to sit him on a wheel chair. She was one of the urse checked his temperature. She told us off coming to AE for nothing. I was shocked my son was in so much pain. We were there from  4pm till next day  3a.m.  Doctors were so amazing but front nursing staff need more training to manage their anger I heard her critising my son with other nurse. Very dissapointed with that. Thank so much to all the other sadly only need one person to ruin everything.

readBy.name: Chelsea and Westminster Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Awful practice
body:
Receptionist rude and very inconsiderate. I’m not able to make any appointment. Constantly excuse with Coronavirus. Promise call back from the doctor and I did never receive one. 
Complain via email- complain procedures but never received any response from the practice manager. After 2 ignored emails my family looking for different surgery. 
You can not believe my frustration. Feel e- console and it’s saying to call the surgery. Called the surgery and the rude receptionist suggested that I’m stupid and I don’t know how to feel e-console. 
From yesterday waiting for doctors to call me

title: Awful practice
body:
Receptionist rude and very inconsiderate. I’m not able to make any appointment. Constantly excuse with Coronavirus. Promise call back from the doctor and I did never receive one. 
Complain via email- complain procedures but never received any response from the practice manager. After 2 ignored emails my family looking for different surgery. 
You can not believe my frustration. Feel e- console and it’s saying to call the surgery. Called the surgery and the rude receptionist suggested that I’m stupid and I don’t know how to feel e-console. 
From yesterday waiting for doctors to call me

title: Efficient service
body: Excellent experience - I used the online system to ask a question to a doctor when my 9 month old baby was poorly. Within the hour, I had received a text message with a face to face appointment time later that morning. I went to the surgery and was seen quickly by a lovely GP who efficiently assessed, diagnosed and prescribed treatment. I could not have asked for a better service - thank you so much. My only quibble is that the reception team were quick to tell me there were no appointments available that day and that "you could try the online service". This could have easily put me off and made me turn to 111/A&E, particularly as an anxious first time mother. I would ask that the reception team explain how the online system works a little better to reassure patients that this is an appropriate service to use in order to access necessary appointments and/or treatment from their clinician.

title: Not helpful
body:
I was very very ill and forced myself in the condition I was to go to the GP and they said you need to do an ONLINE consultation.!!!
And when I did the result literally stated I will seek medical advise myself!
What the heck?!!
And if it’s very severe call 111
Never ever going there again.

title: Update for my review
body: Further comment to the review I left earlier had the GP ring me at around 6.53pm this evening in response to the said urgent email. Chemist is closed so will have to deal with Medication collection tomorrow [Saturday] nice that it was dealt with and I thank those involved. but if it had been resolved at end of morning surgery I could have collected the said medication that same afternoon.

title: Great care
body: Despite the current immense pressures, a GP from the practice texted me late on a Friday evening to give me advice when I was worried and really needed it. Thank you so much.

title: Great Practice
body: My family have been coming here for 20 years and there have been no issues. Most of the GPs are extremely helpful. I also agree with a previous post that the nurse who did a recent smear test for me was excellent and really helpful - alleviating my previous fear.

title: Horrible practice
body: I was told by 111 to go to this hospitals a&e within an hour as its an emergency so I did. 4 hours later and I had only been triaged (i was also the only person in the waiting room). Then a nurse told me she’d be with me in a minute to do my ecg, she just had to sort out the room and get the machine. 45 minutes later she was nowhere to be seen. 30 mins after that I asked a nurse what was happening with my ecg and got told that I am being impatient and I need to wait for someone to come and she didnt know how long it’d be. Overall I left the a&e without getting any tests done.

title: Great care
body:
I would just like to say thank you to everyone for the care I received at the SAU and especially the nurses, surgeon and anesthetist on the DTU.
You looked after me and made me feel calm and relaxed and for that I am very grateful.
It was extremely busy at the hospital which meant I had to wait three days until all assessments and surgery was completed, this really did not matter and is quite insignificant compared to how difficult the current situation is and how hard everyone is having to work.
The NHS really is amazing and needs to be protected at all costs.
Thank you all very much

readBy.name: North West Anglia NHS Foundation Trust

title: Poor service.
body: After receiving a text from a dr to ask me to book an appointment to discuss test results I was told you can no longer make appointments, I must phone every day. When I mentioned I booked one a few weeks ago the receptionist just said “that was then” how can COVID be blamed for not being able to book an appointment in a few days.   Really poor service and rude receptionist

title: Speedy and efficient
body: I called 111 about my son who had an infection that was spreading and tracking up his arm through his veins. The infection was hot and swollen with pus filled bumps and was worsening by the day. He was feeling generally unwell, lethargic and hot. I could not get an appointment with the GP so called 111 for advice. I was told a doctor would call within 6 hours, however we received a call within 5 minutes. The doctor asked lots of questions to get a clear picture of what was going on and advised an ambulance due to concerns of sepsis. The ambulance arrived within 20 minutes and they were amazing. Checked his blood pressure, Sat's, blood etc and after doing the liaising with the doctor for us, they had him sorted on antibiotics within 30 minutes! We are very thankful for their speedy response and for how kind, professional and reassuring everyone was that we dealt with.

title: Excellent care and treatment
body: I underwent my second colonoscopy recently and once again the whole service was excellent. Everyone was so professional and skilled but at the same time so caring and friendly. There were clear and easily understood instructions and the process from admission to discharge went very smoothly. Thank you to everyone

title: Excellent service
body:
I recently had an operation undertaken by Urology consultant, both my wife and I cannot fault the level of care, knowledge and overall professionalism of all the staff involved, especially my consultant and his secretary who were so caring and understood our anxieties at a diffcult time.  Thank you to the whole team, the service was outstanding and I would highly recommend this hospital.
Attended Chester Suite December 2021.

title: Good but too far from home address
body: The physiotherapist was brilliant. He cured my sciatica and was very kind and gentle. I had every confidence in him but would prefer a practice closer to my home as travelling for 10 miles is difficult for me

title: Great service and very supportive
body:
I find the service at the surgery to be efficient and well run.
It is easy to get hold of the surgery,either through email or the telephone.
Staff get back to you within a short time.
Appointments have mainly been over the phone for me recently due to covid restrictions but they have been thorough and very helpful.
I cannot fault the work of the practice.
Thank you.

title: No privacy
body:
On arrival you have to book in with reception and it is a terrible set up.  
 You have to shout out your personal information and your health conditions.  I try to avoid ever going there, unless I am really desperate.  
The reception staff needs training on being a little more confidential.  They do shout out your personal information and are very condescending towards certain patients, they need to be a bit compassionate too.

title: If you need a good gp practice dont register
body: Never knew trying to book for a common blood test could be so hard. My appointments have been cancelled 3/4 times with no explanation

title: Great experience getting my booster
body: I wanted to share my thanks and gratitude for a great experience getting my covid 19 booster vaccine at Raphael House. The process was highly efficient and the staff were organised and helpful. I love the NHS (and the people who make it work).

title: Great service
body: I have visited the surgery twice in just over a month. I have to say my experience both times left me feeling really grateful. Both of my appointments were related and dealt with efficiently. I was treated with respect and my dignity maintained  throughout. At a time of real difficulty for practices, the service I received was exemplary from each individual, from making my initial appointment over the phone to my arrival and departure. The medical practitioners undertook their roles with great enthusiasm and professionalism. Thank you so much.

title: Poor Communication
body: I was at the surgery for a booked appointment, only to get there waited outside in the cold weather just because the receptionist was on the phone. On getting into the surgery, I was told no one available to see me as the doctor didn't attend the surgery. Furious, as I could have been notified hours before then. Not impressed.

title: Some facility lacking
body: It's very good surgery,  specious space for the patients,  it will be a great help,  if small area to be make, for prayer area. It will be very easy to be on time for the appointment. Specially practicing Muslim to be on time, as they can be there earlier for their appointment. Sometimes praying at home, then rushing for the appointment.

title: Aka great practice
body: Had a appointment last Tuesday they told me that doctor will ring me midday . Comes at 9.22 my phone rang literally 3 second then cut off . Cos I didn’t not slept that day . Hence my both fingers broken also run out my meds  I was awake  the whole night prior. Then I rang back the women on the phone talking to me like I made the mistake not answering the call ,she was rude , had attitude that you simply wouldn’t want to hear especially all I wanted to speak to doctor .then she said at the end of the conversation I l let doctor know then get back to me well today Saturday not heard a thing since.  Surely you don’t want us sit by the phone or glue to the phone all day to wait for a call come through. I suggest get a grip in what you do  or whatever’s job you do treat people fairly .

title: Awful care, awful peole
body: Absoulty awful experience under the Andover mental health team. Was with them 2 years and they have done nothing but mess me around, constantly changing, cancelling appointments or not even doing them. Very unprofessional an uncaring staff, rude and disrespectful. They completely messed me around and didn't even tel me my support worker had finished with me, and she was extremely unreliable. They are an absolute joke. I do not recommend receiving mental health care from these people, it will make you worse like it has me. They don't do anything

title: Shocking
body: What's happend? Used to be a good surgery that's why I moved to it, and now where do I start you can't get through on the phones I rung 3 times to cancel my appointment on Thursday and couldn't get through, having to go for weekly appointments I'm still waiting for a phone call so they can make an appointment next week. Medication is always wrong every week and the app well what's the point of it? It's blocked from most of its use you can't message anyone you can't make an appointment on It crazy good staff have recently left which speaks volumes.

title: Great staff
body: I was at The Sloane yesterday for a small operation, the doctors, nurses, all the staff were so kind and caring, would highly recommend.

title: Outstanding Gp and services
body:
GP goes out of his way to support people with covid. Outstanding Surgery of 2022
Carrying, concerned,  providing extra help.

title: The best practice with wonderful staff
body: What a fantastic surgery. The doctors and nurses are extremely understanding and compassionate. They listen to your concerns and then discuss your treatment options with you. Prescription requests are sorted immediately and sent to the local chemist. The econsult service is great and the staff ring back to speak to you quickly - if a phone call isn’t possible, they often email or text. The admin staff are very efficient and helpful too.

title: Amazing team
body: I attended the drop in vaccination centre at Salt Hill today. The team of staff that I spoke to were absolutely amazing and I cannot thank them enough for their support, compassion and understanding. Thank you so much for supporting me in having my 1st Covid vaccination.

title: Efficient, easy, friendly
body: Without a doubt, every time I need services from the Pulteney Practice in Bath, my issue is resolved. Whether it’s to schedule an appointment, for an urgent prescription, or for my booster jab, the process is always quick and easy. I’m especially grateful for the efficiency of some of the doctors - when an urgent prescription is needed, they send it right away. Might I also add I didn’t even realise the needle had gone in when I had my booster!

title: Friendly and helpful.
body: Staff were welcoming and reassuring. Minor back surgery done painlessly. Given advice on  after care ,new dressings and an appointment for stitches to be removed.

title: Excellent therapist
body: I visited Ascenti for continuation physiotherapy, a further three appointments had been made. I have been impressed with the therapist who saw me throughout my treatment. I had been following the exercises as recommended and was definitely feeling stronger and in less pain as a result. It was mutually decided that I could be discharged to continue with the exercises myself at home. Very pleased

title: Great and fast practice
body:
I just wanted to say thank you for a very fast and professional service 
Thanks for all the support

title: Exemplary Care at the QE Hospital
body:
This is to thank everyone at the QE who provided a thoroughly caring, effective and and efficient service when I attended after I slipped and injured my wrist.
On 23rd December at about 5pm I walked into A&E having suffered what turned out to be a broken wrist.  I was expecting to have a longish wait for treatment, but by soon after 8pm I was able to leave, with my fracture fully stabilised and the pain relieved.  Everyone who dealt with me during those three hours, and on subsequent visits connected with my ongoing treatment, has been highly professional, attentive and understanding.
I would like to thank especially:
•	The practitioner at the Urgent Treatment Centre, who explained the nature of my injury and organised the management of my treatment throughout (…and who skilfully removed my, by then, rather tightly fitting wedding ring from the injured hand, making certain I took care of it)
•	The orthopaedic doctor who, with the support of the practitioner and a nurse, re-positioned, set and plastered my fracture and explained clearly how the injury and its initial treatment would be assessed the following morning, and what the options might then be.
Thank you all.  I’m very grateful for what's being done at the QE to support my recovery.  I will be making a donation to your charity, QE Charitable Funds.

title: Impressed
body: I had to go to A and E due to a severe pain in my leg. I was very impressed with the service given from booking in to being seen by doctors. I was out within 4 hours, much quicker than I thought it would be. Well done the Countess.

title: Life saving action
body: In early January my wife lost consciousness and stopped breathing. The 999 Ambulance response was rapid and effective, the telephone responder was measured, reassuring and quietly told me of actions to take which saved her. The first paramedic arrived at the time followed soon after two more in the ambulance. They continued to care for her until handover to the hospital A&E, until they left they provided updates for me much to my relief. We will always be grateful for their help.

title: Great service
body: Very helpful and great service. Always professional and try their best. Keep up the good work and thank you for all you do.

title: Excellent delivery of service
body: Booked the kids in for their first jabs. They were nervous and despite wanting the vaccine almost backed out at the last minute but they decided to go ahead. I was concerned by how they would react at the point of vaccination but we arrived and were welcomed in such a friendly manner they relaxed a little, the service was so quick and efficient they didn’t have time to worry, they were straight in for the vaccination with a patient, friendly and experienced nurse and we were straight out with stickers. It was really appreciated. Thank you.

title: Fantastic Service
body: My husband has never been in hospital in his life but recently has been admitted via a 999 call three times this month! I cannot praise the Emergency staff more or the care he received  and is receiving in the hospital Truly First Class

readBy.name: Mid Essex Hospital Services NHS Trust

title: Caring for people
body: Thanks to all the doctors and staff at the Radiotherapy Dept for your caring and concern whilst I was having treatment for porocarcenoma for 6 weeks. I can't thank you enough for care etc. Keep up the very high standard of service and needed fight against cancer at Weston Park. Your all amazing. Many many thanks.

readBy.name: Sheffield Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Thank you Pilgrim
body: Had cause to attend A&E this morning in some considerable discomfort and dreading the anticipated wait on a bank holiday with GP practices closed. The wait time cited on arrival was indeed 5 hours. However, having checked in, I was called after about 20 minutes for some tests which were carried out quickly and professionally, returned to the waiting room and, to my astonishment, was called after about another 20 minutes for the results, diagnosis and prescription, not to mention reassurance. I was home again within the hour. Can't thank staff enough.

title: Excellent Treatment - Fantastic staff, good…
body:
I had a high risk pregnancy and part of the preventative treatment included having a blood exchange. The first time I visited the Haematology Day unit, I was understandably quite nervous. The staff there welcomed me and treated me with such care and consideration  all my nerves and worries were allayed. I had around 4 blood exchanges during my pregnancy. Not all of them were easy due to problems with my veins or blood and the staff did all they could to make the process as comfortable as possible. The attentiveness, knowledge and dedication of the staff is commendable and should be celebrated. A big , big thank you to the team on the day unit - you made each and every difficult blood exchange as pleasant and stress free as you possibly could. I have a healthy baby boy and the staff in the unit were a big part of that. 
Thank you

title: Making quality of life better
body: Thanks to the cardiology team at Basildon hospital for getting my father mobile again after a very complex procedure and once again thanks very much

title: Absolutely Phenomenal Care
body:
Referred by my GP to KMH sleep medicine and not my local hospital, as it was presumed I did not have Sleep Apnea . Assessed really quickly and have light Sleep Apnea. By no means, the effects it has had on me were light though.

The sleep clinic team are brilliant, knowledgeable and professional while very personable and caring. I am now using the CPAP and this has improved my quality of life so much, it's amazing. The fibromyalgia symptoms have eased which I am sure is due to having quality sleep

Credit where credit is due, just remember, be kind to staff they are working under immense pressure to see people and doing their level best.
Thanks  to the Sleep Clinic Team you are amazing :)

title: Lovely staff!
body: Took my son to the UTC and the ladies in UTC where fantastic! They were so accommodating and friendly , I was extremely grateful. The gentleman on the main reception as you walk into the hospital was not as friendly and made me feel like I was in the wrong for being there.

readBy.name: Derbyshire Community Health Services NHS Foundation Trust

title: Thorough, responsive practice and kind…
body: I would like to thank a locum GP, my own GP and the kind and friendly reception staff at Woodingdean Medical Centre. I was also impressed at the speed at which I was put through to reception and the actions they took to quickly process my request, and then inform me of the outcome. Thank you.

title: Absolutely fantastic service
body:
My wife fell downstairs at 7:30 this morning sustaining a head injury.  I took her straight to Calderdale A&E where we arrived before 8 am.  We explained we were due to leave home at 11 o’clock for Manchester Airport to go on our honeymoon.  In just over an hour she been examined, 10 stitches above her eye and everything dressed and we left hospital at 9:15.  My wife and I cannot thank everyone in the A & E department.  The service was truly fantastic.  I am writing this review in the lounge at Manchester Airport awaiting our flight.
thank you you all so very much

title: WONDERFUL SERVICE
body: Your  Audiology Speciality unit has been wonderfully efficient and helpful since my GP reffered me to them in November.  Everyone has been friendly and very helpful and after many decades of hearing loss (deafened by gunfire in the Army in 1951/2) I can now hear perfectly well - after only 4 days after the aids were fitted.  In about 8 weeks from start to finish I have seen the delightful audiologist in Cranleigh three times and she couldn't have been mor helpful.

readBy.name: Royal Surrey County Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Phone call from WestCall
body: Been on the phone with 111 with bad back pain over few days with coming back problem for years. 111 service advice to explain to westcall doctor what's been going on and how how long, to explain that GP didn't care at all about my problem. Unfortunately not even westcall doctor cared much. All it sound as she just wanted to tick a box call me back. Every time line was bad and I said I didn't hear her properly she would raise her voice with anger. Not mentioning that she didn't sound interested in what I have been saying to her or trying to explain about my symptoms and pains. 111 consultant was the best person I have spoke so far, interested, caring, giving the right advice. Lady over the phone didn't help much. NHS service its getting worse and worse over the years looks like they don't even care for patients. I wouldn't write a review but I just had enough. Every time I call GP they don't care it doesn't matter if its about me or my children. When I call 111 they try to help but westcall or emergency ward doesn't really look like they to their job.

title: Amazing paramedics
body: My Mum had a stroke last October and the paramedics who arrived on scene were just amazing. Had it not been for their expertise her condition could have been far worse. They were lovely ladies, very kind, patient, professional and approachable. I cannot thank them enough for taking care of my Mum and explaining everything at the same time.

title: Superb Medical and Nursing Care
body:
I had cataract surgery on 13/01/22
the care from beginning to end was outstanding.The expertise and care demonstrated by the consultant and all nursing staff was highly skilled and compassionate. I felt very safe.

title: Absolute appalling amount of help and support
body: My mum fell so we called for a home visit. Four hours late checked to ensure she was on the list. Four hours later called an ambulance after no contact from surgery. Had a call from them the following morning and was informed that she had only just been put on the list. Absolutely fuming with the whole lot of them.

title: Very good experience in A&E
body: My husband was sent to A&E by his GP, who wanted urgent tests for a possible mini stroke. He was triaged, had blood tests, CT scan, was assessed by a stroke nurse, had an ECG and then immediately after that was seen by a stroke doctor. All this within 3hrs, and pleasantly and efficiently done. In the end it was something different but we cannot fault the treatment he had, both in A&E and on the stroke ward overnight.

title: Could not be more impressed
body: I went into a&e on Wednesday and then had an operation on friday and was taken care of in knapp ward and every single nurse i saw from the first point until the last was unbelievably friendly and caring even though it is as clear as day they are rushed off their feet. You all do an amazing job and should be so proud of yourself. Thankyou all so much for your time and care

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust (2)

title: Great service
body: Extremely helpful. Listened to my problems and worked with me to releave the pain. Will use again if required.

title: Amazing service
body: I am incredibly grateful for the care provided by staff in A&E, the fracture clinic and orthopaedics over the past week. A senior nurse also kindly took the time to walk me to the correct department when I got lost despite this being out of her way.  This was by far the most consistent demonstration of warmth and professionalism (by all staff members) that I have ever experienced in a hospital in this country. Keep doing what you're doing!!

title: Great practice
body: I rang the surgery Monday morning due to severe groin pain and back pain.  The GP rang me back and later gave me an appointment sane day evening for a face to face appointment.  I was reassured by the GP and thoroughly checked which made me less stressed

title: Much needed guidance
body: My first Ascenti input came three months after my knee replacement operation and I would have benefitted from having that much earlier. When I was eventually given an appointment, I was greatly reassured following the physiotherapist's assessment of my condition and progress following my operation. Following that, I was given stretching exercises which enabled me improve the straightening  and bending of my leg. As time passed, the physiotherapist identified a back problem which had developed and recommended exercises to address that problem.

title: Crear practice
body: Very Wells  l feel very nice whith the doctor and l was very Happy whith the practice there are a crear people.

title: Covid clinic
body:
Attended the covic vaccination clinic yesterday and have to say it was extremely well organised. Excellent service.
Well done Rivermead Medical Centre.

title: Excellent staff
body: I would like to thank St John's ambulance staff taking Dad & I to A& E. The care and compassion was excellent. They ensured we were sorted straight away. The A & E staff were on the ball and treated Dad with respect, compassion and care. We was dealt with quite promptly with his ailments and the staff were amazing and I thanked every member who cared for Dad. The pressure they are under but they still give 100% care to each patient. A big massive thankyou to everyone and Dad came home the same day and hopefully will make a good recovery.

title: Excellent service
body:
The reception staff were friendly and helpful.
The doctor listened to my problem before sorting it out for me.
Doing a great job in difficult times..

title: Very Good Practice
body: Our family have been at the surgery for years. We have always had excellent care and the doctors looked after my late mother-in-law so well. When you are in and out of there a lot you see how much pressure the receptionists work under but they are always helpful and kind. It’s sad that people are keen to criticise and complain without recognising that they are there for us week in week out, especially over the last few difficult years. We are very grateful for all they have done for us. Thank you

title: Excellent care
body:
I would like to thank all the people who were involved in my operation which took place this month. From the person on the reception desk when I arrived, to the surgeon and his team and all the after care team in ESA who looked after me. Their care and dedication was second to none. They really made me feel at ease and were there when I needed them.
Many thanks again and keep up the good work.

readBy.name: York and Scarborough Teaching Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great Experience
body: I went for my covid booster jab and the whole process was quick and easy! The staff were friendly and caring and explained everything well. Thank you!

title: Very accessible and helpful practice
body: The practice has an online system for booking telephone consultation with GPs that is really efficient. Phone consultation was booked for the same week and the GP was extremely helpful, informative and efficient on the phone and was able to make a referral for further help there and then. Very lucky to have this GP practice

title: Excellant service
body:
I have just had my second cataract operation at spa medica willerby Hull and would like to say that the  experience was very good .
The staff were very caring and helpful from start to finish 
And my vision has really improved 
Can’t Thankyou enough

title: Excellent practice
body: Excellent doctors practice,  you can always get an appointment the same day or a call back from doctor,  nothing too much trouble. Excellent reception staff  and practice manager.  The best doctors surgery in the area by far.

title: Rude, unhelpful receptionist
body:
Some of the receptionists at this practice are greatly lacking in any customer service skills and just basic manners!
There are some pleasant ones but the practice is being let down by the ignorant ones. It has nothing at all to do with being overstretched with the current health crisis because they were simply gossiping amongst themselves with one other patient in the waiting room when I visited. The receptionist I spoke to was rude and uncaring and spoke to me like I was a dog. I was very upset to the point that I went home and cried and now don't feel that I can go back even though I have an unresolved health issue.

title: Lockdown restrictions
body: Come on Weston hospital!  There is a reason for lockdown, and you are short of staff, but our loved ones are in there and we cannot visit and cannot find out how they are doing or what they may need.  Wards are not answering phones so we cannot get updates. If we bring things to the hospital we cannot get it to the wards.  Bring it on a weekend we have no hope!  Advised to use the red phone to get put through to the ward so they can come and collect whatever we bring in, except they don't answer the phone!  There must be a way this can be improved.  Maybe your volunteers could help more. Maybe they could cover weekends and drop things to the wards a couple of times a day. It would not take much thought to organise something!  The mental health of all your patients would be improved!

title: Could be better - must try harder
body:
Difficulty in making an appointment to see the Practice Manager - 
Medical services are good - but there doesn't seem to be anyone in charge of the practice.
How do you contact the Practice Manager - thank you

title: Not the same since the pandemic.
body: Prior to the pandemic, I thought this was a very good surgery and the general practitioners who I have seen in the past were good and receptive. I recognise the pandemic has caused major disruption to these services and I am aware this is out of anyone’s control. However, it’s hard not to be frustrated at the fact that the surgery has sent me numerous texts offering me to come in for the vaccine, but it is an absolute myth trying to get a face to face appointment. I have been wrongly put on a course of antibiotics after a telephone appointment that wasn’t the correct treatment for my issue. I learnt this when I went to a&e and the nurses and doctors there said I shouldn’t have taken the course. I don’t feel safe anymore or feel like I have somewhere to go for my health concerns. I’m sure I’m not the only one. And I find it quite infuriating that they seem to have capacity to see people to give them vaccines (that i’m sure they’re being paid to administer) but don’t seem able to hold face to face appointments. I don’t want to sound ungrateful or entitled, and I’m sure everyone working at the surgery is doing their absolute best but I think I am just going to have to change surgeries. I feel even more anxiety when I’m ill because I feel I will not be properly treated/ misdiagnosed. Also came in for a blood test that I never got the results for. Just seems to be some negligence going on since covid-19, not very proactive. Again, I really hope I haven’t offended the staff who are doing their absolute best, my issue is with the organisation and efficiency of the surgery.

title: Not good waiting for appointment hide behind …
body:
Not good. Get an appointment  it is a  triage  then wait for doctor telephone appointment after jumping through hoops or not with Doctor  it will be with nurse or another associate can you make a treatment decision NO is the answer why am I seeing you.
Can see my dentist face to face why can’t I see a GP? When you see a GP who are they never  heard of them they are locum’s  here today gone tomorrow. The message on answering service go to walk in centre shut after 22.00 hrs, they refer you back  to your GP might has  well phone the 118  118 up.

title: Lack of information
body: My Dad recently had a catheter fitted. Given that no one is allowed to accompany him due to current restrictions, and that he is hard of hearing and nearly 80 I presumed that he would be sent home with some information/leaflets etc about the procedure he'd had done and the after care required etc. He came home with nothing and struggled to remember the information that he was told at his appointment. He was given one contact telephone number but of course it is obviously office hours only so there was no answer when we rang for help. We have found it really distressing that we have had to use the internet and finally, the 111 service to get help and advice. Not an acceptable way to treat an elderly patient I'm afraid.

readBy.name: University Hospitals of North Midlands NHS Trust
Plymouth University, BSc (Hons) Urgent and Emergency Care 2022

title: Complete waste of time all talk and no action
body:
After having a phone consultation with a Dr at Beacon house and a follow up phone call with their suggested "action plan" I have just been left. 
Told I would receive an e-mail with some useful links that may address the issue of where I felt I needed assistance - None recieved. 
A letter from them with the next appointment details etc - None recieved. 

All this after 3 months of trying to get myself someone help and eventually being taken on by the crisis team. 

This is not the first time Beacon house have failed me with their "novice" approach to mental health issues. 
Infact, I was asked the same "tick box exercise" questions in my latest call with them as I was asked over 10 years ago. 

The reception staff are good and help where they can, but as far as any else goes, it's all talk and no action and they try to dump you onto another agency as soon as they think they can leaving you in limbo with no support. 
As nothing seems to have changed in over 10 years (other than staff) I would strongly suggest avoiding this place at all costs

title: Thorough and knowledgeable doctors
body: The doctors are very thorough and helpful but I would like to see an update of who's who on their website. With fewer face to face appointments it is difficult to keep up with staff changes

title: So kind and helpful
body: I called 111 and got an appointment for medoc within an hour. I waited 30 mins but all was calm and friendly. Both drs I saw were great . Very kind, thorough  and helpful. I got referred to Maidstone hospital. Later in evening one of the drs rang me to check I was ok. Was such a nice gesture and I really appreciated his kindness and thoughtfulness.  I thought it was a great service and was very impressed.

title: Great service and really friendly
body: Hi was admitted to ward b4 and c4 on Thursday 13th as had really bad pain in right side and when I arrived at the surgical assessment ward all staff were really good and made me very comfortable and service was really good once in the ward I was treated very well and was made to feel very comfortable i’am sorry not very good with names but they are all very good and when I was discharge it was all fine overall a very good service even though we’re under pressure and short staff thank you

readBy.name: University Hospitals Dorset NHS Foundation Trust

title: Kind attentions for patients
body: On the 13/01/2022 I had both an appointment with the doctor and  the nurse. When I got  there the doctor took me to have a visit and when I finished that visit the nurse quickly took me in for my other visit and she checked me carefully. That is what I call kind attentions for patients. Thank you so much for your kind attentions.

title: Very helpful and fantastic service
body:
I have had to contact the doctors 3 times in the last couple of months, on each occasion I have had prompt call backs to my e consult and also on another occasion an appointment the same day.
A fabulous surgery.

author: Martr73
title: Pre-op Appointment
body: I would just like to thank Jane, Laura and Dawn for being so friendly, professional and kind this morning. Every team would benefit from having these 3 lovely ladies working with them.

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

author: Joice
title: Poor Gynaecology support
body:
After 4 years of waiting for an appointment, the GP got me an emergency gynaecology appointment. The gynaecologist didn't give me any solutions.  
After that, I went for treatment at Albyn hospital. I was paying £200 and they were terrible with me. I was thinking that if I spoke to the senior staff they could find a solution to my problem, but nothing at all. I found the senior staff at Albyn to be terrible.

readBy.name: Office of Alexander Burnett, MSP for Aberdeenshire West

author: milly1712
title: Seriously needs to improve
body:
I believe that this practice needs to be put under review by the NHS as it is virtually impossible to get through to get help.  
I have been in a queue for an hour and a half, only to be told to come in on the day to try and get an appointment that way.  
I needed an urgent referral to hospital for my child ( which the hospital secretary is aware needs to be done and is waiting for due to protocol). Only to get the first call adviser at the GP surgery saying to me that it would take at least 2 weeks to get a GP to speak to me.  
I find this outrageous and feel the owner of this practice needs to pull their finger out and do something.

author: ophiuchuskz75
title: Never available for consultation
body: I am consistently unable to get in contact with my GP to schedule an online consult. I phone several times a day and am left on hold. I try to book an appointment on the online system but there are never any available slots.
